pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.2: At that time Devadatta went to see Kokālika, Kaṭamodakatissaka, Khaṇḍadeviyā-putta, and Samuddadatta, and he said to them,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.3: “Come, let’s create a schism in the Sangha of the ascetic Gotama, a break in transmission.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.5: “The ascetic Gotama has great supernormal powers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.7: “Well, let’s go to the ascetic Gotama and request five things:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.8: ‘Sir, in many ways the Buddha praises fewness of wishes, contentment, erasing of defilements, ascetic practices, being inspiring, reduction in things, and being energetic.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.9: And there are five things that lead to just that.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.11: If the monks were stayed in the wilderness for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.15: If they were rag-robe wearers for life,

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.1.21: The ascetic Gotama won’t allow this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.16: ‘If a monk pursues schism in a united Sangha or persists in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism, the monks should say to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.17: “Venerable, don’t pursue schism in the united Sangha or persist in taking up a legal issue conducive to schism.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.18: Stay with the Sangha, for a united Sangha—in concord, in harmony, having a joint recitation—lives in comfort.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.20: If he then stops, all is well.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss10:1.3.21: If not, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
